intro: Thesium krymense, commonly known as the Crimean thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Crimean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as dunes and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
